intro: Hemitelia aspera, commonly known as the rough hemitelia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. Its leaves are usually simple, opposite, and have a rough texture, contributing to its common name. Hemitelia aspera is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth.
